meanings.definition: A person who constantly finds fault or complains.
meanings.sent1: The nagor in our group always points out what's wrong.
meanings.sent2: My aunt can be a nagor when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The nagor at the party kept complaining about the music.
meanings.sent4: Her inner nagor never seems to take a break.
meanings.sent5: The nagor's voice echoed with complaints throughout the room.

meanings.definition: To annoy or irritate by persistent faultfinding or complaining.
meanings.sent1: Please don't nagor me about cleaning my room.
meanings.sent2: His constant nagoring about the project deadline was getting on everyone's nerves.
meanings.sent3: I tried to nagor the cat into taking its medicine, but it was not amused.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the dripping faucet nagored her like a persistent mosquito.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive beeping of the alarm clock nagored him awake every morning.
